website_summaries.verdict: Pro skater Justin “Figgy” Figueroa’s signature pro model from Emerica, the Emerica Figueroa, gets a noteworthy upgrade in the Emerica Figgy Dose skate shoes. The reviews for the Emerica Figgy Dose are mostly positive, thanks to the Formula G rubber compound that’s more durable than traditional cupsoles. It is built for skate-ready performance; hence, it delivers superb grip and support without compromising comfort and street-ready aesthetic. Although narrow-fitting and requires some break-in period, the Figgy Dose is another great skate shoe model from Emerica.
pros: Numerous reviewers commended the durability of the Emerica Figgy Dose sneakers
Like most Emerica low-top sneakers, these skate shoes present lots of color options
This model from the skate shoe lineup of Emerica brand impressed many reviewers with its superb grip
Several reviewers mentioned that Emerica truly stepped up its game as far as quality is concerned through this particular rendition of the Emerica Figgy skate shoes
A few reviewers noted that the Figgy Dose is an excellent upgrade and a far shot away from the original Figgy skate shoe
Several skaters liked the gusseted tongue and internal cleatie of this shoe because they can wear it comfortably even without laces
Many commented that this Emerica shoe is overall comfortable whether on or off the board
This shoe offers excellent support, according to a couple of buyers
Affordability is one of the strongest features of this shoe
cons: Numerous observations stated that the Emerica Figgy Dose offers less boardfeel than the original skate shoe model
Some skaters and casual wearers mentioned that this shoe takes time breaking in
A few users observed that it fits narrow or tight in the toe area
Some skaters commented that this is bulkier than the first Figgy shoe

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 in vans and a 9 fit me slightly too narrow to start, but it broke in wonderfully and now has a very snug, stable fit that feels perfect to skate in. Consider a half step up if that's not your thing, but for me its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Panther

customer_reviews.title: Quality problems.
customer_reviews.text: Both shoes were different shades of brown. Left shoe was great but the right shoe was tight. Like it was a different size. Besides that. Weird art on the insole was a put off. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: BOC1972

customer_reviews.title: For a skate shoe, cant go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, these shoes are some of the beat skate shoes out there. Emerica puts out quality shoes. Always satisfied. Never have an issue with sizing when I order. Been skating for a long time, love the board feel and overall comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and great for skate performance
customer_reviews.text: This is the best skate shoe I’ve ever had just due to it being great for so many types of skating with a perfect break in the only thing is they are very stiff at first but break them in and you’ll want to buy another pair Ik I am after these are thru had them already over two months and still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but I would buy them a size larger than you need
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes but they did come a little bit small
customer_reviews.author: Thomas McManus

customer_reviews.title: Purchase Price and Fit
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit well but didn't last very long, for a skate shoe
customer_reviews.author: Rufusg1952

customer_reviews.title: vulcanized sole would make the shoe perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product design, amazing material, but being a cup soul they’re super stiff and take much longer to break in. If it was a vulcanized soul the shoe would be perfect. Should’ve chosen a vulcanized soul figgy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie/Mike Gildenpfennig

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Even if I got the next size up it wouldn’t have fit. It is way too narrow. Design look was cool though
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Incredible shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe from a great company. Amazing price as well. Arrived on time and fits perfectly. Highly recommend Emerica shoes for other skateboarders.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing to work for a few weeks, comfortable, if you have wide feet probably stay away. As far as how good they are for skateboarding I could not say.
customer_reviews.author: montana puckett

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Feels great
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels great. I love them. I just wear them as casual shoes when I'm not working and just hanging out with friends or socializing whenever I am able to do so. I don't skate in them. I gave that up earlier this year.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Ligon

customer_reviews.title: Painfully tight
customer_reviews.text: Laces shredded in less than an hour. Also painfully tight where laces start on shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

product_meta.title: Emerica Men's FIGGY DOSE Skate Shoe, Grey/Black, 6 UK
product_meta.description: The figgy dose is Justin figueroa's second pro model for Emerica; designed by big fig himself. The figgy dose features a newly designed rubber compound we're calling formula "g", designed and tested to be even grippier and longer lasting than the standard rubber formula. The figgy dose also incorporates a perforated spandex fit system for better breathability, a full length eva midsole built to endure heavy impacts, and a one-piece toe cap for better durability. Our classic triangle tread is back and it's been updated with our new flex channel technology, for superior board feel without sacrificing grip or durability. A shoe you can skate just as hard in concrete pools or jumping on some steep ass steel rails; the figgy dose was built to skate whatever figgy skates: everything.
